intro: Conyza manillensis, commonly known as the Manilla weed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with fine hairs, while its seeds are small and dispersed by wind. Conyza manillensis is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
